important_phrase: Further  price increases were noted in energy, metals, and agricultural goods
Automobile production  continued to decline as well
New home inventories continued  to moderate while inventories of existing homes increased
The  outlook among retail contacts was mixed, but most did not expect a significant  increase in sales in the near-term
Retail leasing activity has been strong among  tourist-oriented shops in Maine,  but slower in strip-mall developments across the region, where vacancy appears  to be up slightly
One contact believes recent economic  uncertainty has augmented business, with client companies increasingly turning  to temporary staffing to avoid long-term obligations

One-half of respondents are adding technology  workers and sales staff, although at a much slower pace than during the  previous quarter; among the other half, one firm has increased employment  significantly, while the remaining firms are holding headcount stable
Retail leasing activity has been strong among  tourist-oriented shops in Maine,  but slower in strip-mall developments across the region, where vacancy appears  to be up slightly
Inventory  levels and employment are generally stable, with several respondents  scrutinizing the need for future hiring
Corn prices drifted lower during the reporting period, while soybean prices  picked up again
Manufacturing activity weakened slightly, but business conditions  remained solid
Wge  pressures were limited outside of the skilled labor positions that continue to  experience shortages and a report of union wage demands from some skilled  trades in the construction industry
Business loan demand increased  slightly, particularly for commercial and industrial loans
Employment  conditions in the District weakened slightly, with Michigan  and Wsconsin exhibiting larger  declines
Demand slowly returned to some  markets as inquiries were reported to have increased, particularly among  first-time home buyers
Light vehicle sales also slowed, although  inventory levels remained at comfortable levels
Employment levels increased slightly, and producers are looking to  expand payrolls
The housing industry remains  weak, with little expectation of improvement for the remainder of the  year
Reports on core deposits were mixed
On a  year-over-year basis, reports were evenly split between production slowdowns  and increases, with only one company experiencing a significant increase
New home  prices have been relatively stable since our last report, though discounting  has increased
District  retailers reported flat to improving sales across all segments since our last  report
Rain improved conditions in most areas, but poor moisture in the Texas High  Plains has led to lower projections for wheat yields
Agricultural  activity improved
The  labor market remained relatively tight
Overall, past due loans remain low, and there has been  no significant decline in credit quality, although respondents expect  deterioration
Legal activity continued to be strong,  but the mix of work suggests slower economic activity
Housing activity continued to decline
Automobile  sales weakened slightly and remained below year-ago levels
Manufacturing activity  improved slightly due to rising exports
District hiring announcements  continued to outpace layoff announcements
Recent rainfall across much of the Plains  eased drought concerns and improved pasture and growing conditions
Manufacturing activity improved somewhat  since March and early April, but remained sluggish compared to year-ago  levels
Commercial real estate construction remained solid since the last survey  though the number of sales declined
Retail sales were flat compared to the previous survey period and were  below expectations
Agricultural conditions weakened  since the last report
Labor markets were  flat overall, while wages increased moderately
Overall wages increased moderately
Overall manufacturing  activity increased slightly since the last report
Commercial real estate was up  modestly
Overall consumer spending was soft
Despite less-than-ideal weather, crop  conditions generally improved for most reporting Districts
Three Districts  described economic activity as softer, weaker, or lower, with an additional  four Districts reporting slower, sluggish, or modest economic growth
Atlanta  reported commercial lending activity as mixed
Demand growth for service providers slowed in  the San Francisco District
Scattered reports from Philadelphia  and Kansas City indicated seasonal  improvements
Consumer spending slowed further since the  last report
Housing markets weakened  further, with sales activity down and prices flat to lower
Respondents indicate continued  tightening of credit standards across all loan categories, most evidently in the  commercial mortgage category

New    York Stte  manufacturers report that business activity remained sluggish in May; contacts again  report increasingly widespread hikes in prices paid but only moderate increases  in selling prices
New Jersey's office rental and sales markets  are also reported to be increasingly soft, with a fair amount of new  development said to be in the pipeline
Retailers report that sales were mixed in April and  May; on average, sales were relatively close to plan and little changed from a  year ago
Bank lending has been increasing slowly
Some contacts noted  that slower business activity or delays in expansion plans were resulting in  reductions in current and prospective employment
Total outstanding  loans at Third District banks rose slowly in May
The outlook in the  Third District manufacturing sector has improved since the last Beige Book
Residential real estate agents reported sales of  existing homes were edging up modestly in many parts of the region, and new  home sales have increased slightly in some areas, as well
Wth an uncertain  outlook, many retail companies in the region are postponing expansion plans and  limiting capital improvements
Cooler-than-normal temperatures in  recent weeks slowed the planting and development of District crops
Many services providers reported slower revenue growth in recent weeks,  although some resort locations saw increased activity over the Memorial Day  weekend

Fifth District  temporary employment agents reported somewhat 
  weaker demand for workers in recent weeks
"  Reports on credit standards revealed modest  tightening at some institutions
Contacts largely  attributed the lower pace to weaker domestic sales
Commercial  real estate market conditions softened further
According to most retail contacts,  sales declined in recent weeks

Oil and natural  gas extraction expanded further in response to growing demand, although these  activities reportedly were constrained slightly by tight availability of some  types of equipment and materials
Retail sales were weak and demand growth  slowed for service providers
Upward wage pressures were limited,  with contacts noting only small increases in overall labor costs
Reports on  commercial and industrial lending suggested a slight easing overall, with some  contacts reporting weak demand and others reporting little change
Petroleum refiners had been operating at  relatively low utilization rates, but production activity rose recently
Housing markets remained  exceptionally weak during the survey period, while conditions in nonresidential  real estate markets softened a bit further

Retail sales held steady or  softened further, with many respondents pointing to increases 
in food and energy prices as a restraining factor on sales of other  products
Corn and soybean  planting in Missouri has been delayed more than in other  states in the District, but cotton and rice planting is ahead of normal
Retail  and auto sales declined in April and early May compared with a year ago
Credit standards  for consumer loans ranged from unchanged to tightened somewhat, while demand  ranged from about the same to moderately weaker
Manufacturing activity has increased  slightly since our previous report
Contacts in Memphis reported slowed development of  industrial projects
Jewelry and food were strong sellers, while  gift items, home décor, and clothing moved more slowly
